intro: Coprosma prisca, commonly known as the ancient coprosma, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are typically red or black when mature. Coprosma prisca thrives in coastal and forested areas, often growing in well-drained soils. Its foliage is dense and evergreen, making it a popular ornamental plant in horticulture.
